intro: Meniscium kapplerianum, commonly known as the Kappler's meniscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or riverine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
